segment.source: 6144(S) Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.
segment.target: 6144(S) Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 6144(S) Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.
segment.target: Describes security event 6144(S) Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.

segment.source: 6144(S): Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.
segment.target: 6144(S): Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time settings from the “Security Settings” section in the group policy object are applied successfully to a computer, without any errors.
segment.target: This event generates every time settings from the “Security Settings” section in the group policy object are applied successfully to a computer, without any errors.

segment.source: This event generates on the target computer itself.
segment.target: This event generates on the target computer itself.

segment.source: It is a routine event which shows you the list of Group Policy Objects that include “Security Settings” policies, and that were applied to the computer.
segment.target: It is a routine event which shows you the list of Group Policy Objects that include “Security Settings” policies, and that were applied to the computer.

segment.source: This event generates every time Group Policy is applied to the computer.
segment.target: This event generates every time Group Policy is applied to the computer.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Return Code Type = UInt32: always has “0” value for this event.
segment.target: Return Code Type = UInt32: always has “0” value for this event.

segment.source: GPO List Type = UnicodeString: the list of Group Policy Objects that include “Security Settings” policies, and that were applied to the computer.
segment.target: GPO List Type = UnicodeString: the list of Group Policy Objects that include “Security Settings” policies, and that were applied to the computer.

segment.source: The format of the list item is: “GROUPPOLICYGUID GROUPPOLICYNAME”.
segment.target: The format of the list item is: “GROUPPOLICYGUID GROUPPOLICYNAME”.

segment.source: You can find specific GROUPPOLICYGUID using Get-GPO PowerShell cmdlet with “–Name GROUPPOLICYNAME” parameter.
segment.target: You can find specific GROUPPOLICYGUID using Get-GPO PowerShell cmdlet with “–Name GROUPPOLICYNAME” parameter.

segment.source: Row “Id” is the GUID of the Group Policy:
segment.target: Row “Id” is the GUID of the Group Policy:

segment.source:
Note
GUID is an acronym for 'Globally Unique Identifier'.
segment.target:
Note
GUID is an acronym for 'Globally Unique Identifier'.

segment.source: It is a 128-bit integer number used to identify resources, activities or instances.
segment.target: It is a 128-bit integer number used to identify resources, activities or instances.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 6144(S): Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.
segment.target: For 6144(S): Security policy in the group policy objects has been applied successfully.

segment.source: If you have a pre-defined list of Group Policy Objects which contain Security Settings and must be applied to specific computers, then you can compare the list from this event with your list and in case of any difference trigger an alert.
segment.target: If you have a pre-defined list of Group Policy Objects which contain Security Settings and must be applied to specific computers, then you can compare the list from this event with your list and in case of any difference trigger an alert.

segment.source: This event is mostly an informational event.
segment.target: This event is mostly an informational event.
